content:
I want to use Lean in a terminal with nvim, but there is a little detail that
bothers me.

In a terminal, the empty set character ∅ visually occupies more than one cell, but the
terminal only reserves one cell for it. It looks buggy.

From what I have searched, the problem is that ∅ has East_Asian_Width =
Neutral, so the function wcwidth only reserves one cell for it.

Screenshot_2023-03-12_17-18-32.png

Does anyone knows how to fix this?

It looks fine here on my terminal + font:

Screenshot-2023-03-13-at-13.18.39.png

(Both in Kitty and Terminal.app as terminals), and my font is Inconsolata, though this also depends on whether your symbol is coming from your monospace font or a backup font (where it's more likely to be more than 1 width wide I think).

Thank you!

I was convinced that the empty set character should be 2-cell wide and that the wcwidth function is wrong. I spend a lot of time trying to "fix" it. It turns out that I just needed to change the font.
Gabriel Jun has marked this topic as resolved.
